text: Marion Leathers Kuntz (June 9, 1924 – July 10, 2010Her obituary) was the Regents Professor of Classics at Georgia State University,Back cover of a book she translated a researcher in the history of Renaissance thought. She authored the first English translation of Jean Bodin's Colloquium heptaplomeres de rerum sublimium arcanis abditis (Colloquium of the Seven about Secrets of the Sublime) in 1975. Her other works include: * Guillaume Postel: Prophet of the Restitution of All Things (1981) *Venice, Myth and Utopian Thought in the Sixteenth Century: Bodin, Postel and the Virgin of Venice. Variorum Collected Studies Series (1999) *The Anointment of Dionisio: Prophecy and Politics in Renaissance Italy (2001) There are others, in total over 35 book chapters and 28 essays and articles. == References == == External links == * Her works at ResearchGate * Encyclopedia.com article Category:1924 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American historians Category:American translators Category:Latin–English translators Category:American philosophers Category:Georgia State University
